docs.lead_paragraph: Consumers cast a worried eye on the bond market as mortgage rates rose, while investors rode a bullish wave to end the week. Blackstone’s founders were poised for a big payoff as they prepared for an initial offering.

docs.abstract: Five Days column; Kellogg Co announced it would stop advertising some of its most popular products to children under age of 12 unless foods met new nutrition guidelines, such as having no more than 12 grams of sugar per serving; photo (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: What's next, Marshmallow Fluff? The Kellogg Company announced that it would stop advertising some of its most popular products to children under the age of 12 unless the foods met new nutrition guidelines, such as having no more than 12 grams of sugar per serving. The new directive, which will be phased in over the next year and a half, affects some of the company's most popular products among children, including Froot Loops, Rice Krispies and Pop-Tarts.
